name: Elf
description: Elves are a magical people of otherworldly grace, living in the world but not entirely part of it. They live in places of ethereal beauty, in the midst of ancient forests or in silvery spires glittering with faerie light.

traits.name: Keen Senses
traits.description: You have proficiency in the Perception skill.

traits.name: Fey Ancestry
traits.description: You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put you to sleep.

name: High Elf
description: As a high elf, you have a keen mind and a mastery of at least the basics of magic. High elves are more common in the worlds of D&D, being found in ancient forests, along the coasts, or in isolated towers where they practice their magical arts.

traits.name: Elf Weapon Training
traits.description: You have proficiency with the longsword, shortsword, Shortbow, and Longbow.

traits.name: Cantrip
traits.description: You know one cantrip of your choice from the wizard spell list. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for it.

traits.name: Extra Language
traits.description: You can read, speak, and write one additional language of your choice.

name: Wood Elf
description: As a wood elf, you have keen senses and intuition, and your fleet feet carry you quickly and stealthily through your native forests. Wood elves tend to be reclusive and distrustful of non-elves.

traits.name: Elf Weapon Training
traits.description: You have proficiency with the longsword, shortsword, Shortbow, and Longbow.

traits.name: Fleet of Foot
traits.description: Your base walking speed increases to 35 feet.

traits.name: Mask of the Wild
traits.description: You can attempt to hide even when you are only lightly obscured by foliage, heavy rain, falling snow, mist, and other natural phenomena.

name: Drow
description: Descended from an earlier subrace of dark-skinned elves, the drow were banished from the surface world for following the goddess Lolth down the path to evil and corruption. Now they have built their own civilization in the depths of the Underdark.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.description: You have disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight when you, the target of your attack, or whatever you are trying to perceive is in direct sunlight.

traits.name: Drow Magic
traits.description: You know the dancing lights cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the faerie fire spell once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. When you reach 5th level, you can cast the darkness spell once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

traits.name: Drow Weapon Training
traits.description: You have proficiency with rapiers, shortswords, and hand crossbows.

name: Half-Elf
description: Walking in two worlds but truly belonging to neither, half-elves combine what some say are the best qualities of their elf and human parents: human curiosity, inventiveness, and ambition tempered by the refined senses, love of nature, and artistic tastes of the elves.

traits.name: Ability Score Increase
traits.description: Your Charisma score increases by 2, and two other ability scores of your choice increase by 1.

traits.name: Fey Ancestry
traits.description: You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put you to sleep.

traits.name: Half-Elf Versatility
traits.description: You can choose to gain proficiency in two skills of your choice, or you can choose one of the following traits based on your elf parentage: Elf Weapon Training, a wizard cantrip, Fleet of Foot, Mask of the Wild, or Drow Magic.

name: Dwarf
description: Bold and hardy, dwarves are known as skilled warriors, miners, and workers of stone and metal. Though they stand well under 5 feet tall, dwarves are so broad and compact that they can weigh as much as a human standing nearly two feet taller.

traits.name: Speed
traits.description: Your speed is not reduced by wearing heavy armor.

traits.name: Dwarven Resilience
traits.description: You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance against poison damage.

traits.name: Dwarven Combat Training
traits.description: You have proficiency with the battleaxe, handaxe, light hammer, and warhammer.

traits.name: Tool Proficiency
traits.description: You gain proficiency with the artisan's tools of your choice: smith's tools, brewer's supplies, or mason's tools.

traits.name: Stonecunning
traits.description: Whenever you make an Intelligence (History) check related to the origin of stonework, you are considered proficient in the History skill and add double your proficiency bonus to the check, instead of your normal proficiency bonus.

name: Hill Dwarf
description: As a hill dwarf, you have keen senses, deep intuition, and remarkable resilience. The gold dwarves of Faerûn in their mighty southern kingdom are hill dwarves, as are the exiled Neidar and the debased Klar of Krynn.

traits.name: Dwarven Toughness
traits.description: Your hit point maximum increases by 1, and it increases by 1 every time you gain a level.

name: Mountain Dwarf
description: As a mountain dwarf, you're strong and hardy, accustomed to a difficult life in rugged terrain. You're probably on the tall side for a dwarf, and tend toward lighter coloration. The shield dwarves of northern Faerûn are mountain dwarves.

traits.name: Dwarven Armor Training
traits.description: You have proficiency with light and medium armor.

name: Dragonborn
description: Born of dragons, as their name proclaims, the dragonborn walk proudly through a world that greets them with fearful incomprehension. Shaped by draconic gods or the dragons themselves, dragonborn originally hatched from dragon eggs as a unique race.

name: Black Dragonborn
description: Black dragonborn trace their ancestry to black dragons, whose acid breath and swamp-dwelling nature have shaped their heritage. They tend toward cruelty and have a strong survival instinct.

traits.name: Breath Weapon
traits.description: You can use your action to exhale a 5 by 30 ft. line of acid. Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC = 8 + Constitution modifier + proficiency bonus). A creature takes 2d6 acid damage on a failed save, and half as much on a successful one. The damage increases to 3d6 at 6th level, 4d6 at 11th level, and 5d6 at 16th level. After using your breath weapon, you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

traits.name: Damage Resistance
traits.description: You have resistance to acid damage.

name: Blue Dragonborn
description: Blue dragonborn descend from the cunning blue dragons of the desert. They value order and tend toward lawful alignments, with a proud bearing that reflects their draconic heritage.

traits.name: Breath Weapon
traits.description: You can use your action to exhale a 5 by 30 ft. line of lightning. Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC = 8 + Constitution modifier + proficiency bonus). A creature takes 2d6 lightning damage on a failed save, and half as much on a successful one. The damage increases to 3d6 at 6th level, 4d6 at 11th level, and 5d6 at 16th level. After using your breath weapon, you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

traits.name: Damage Resistance
traits.description: You have resistance to lightning damage.

name: Brass Dragonborn
description: Brass dragonborn inherit their ancestors' love of conversation and warm climates. They are typically good-natured and gregarious, enjoying the company of others.

traits.name: Breath Weapon
traits.description: You can use your action to exhale a 5 by 30 ft. line of fire. Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC = 8 + Constitution modifier + proficiency bonus). A creature takes 2d6 fire damage on a failed save, and half as much on a successful one. The damage increases to 3d6 at 6th level, 4d6 at 11th level, and 5d6 at 16th level. After using your breath weapon, you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

traits.name: Damage Resistance
traits.description: You have resistance to fire damage.

name: Bronze Dragonborn
description: Bronze dragonborn share their ancestors' sense of justice and love of coastal regions. They often feel drawn to military service or other roles where they can protect the innocent.

traits.name: Breath Weapon
traits.description: You can use your action to exhale a 5 by 30 ft. line of lightning. Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC = 8 + Constitution modifier + proficiency bonus). A creature takes 2d6 lightning damage on a failed save, and half as much on a successful one. The damage increases to 3d6 at 6th level, 4d6 at 11th level, and 5d6 at 16th level. After using your breath weapon, you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

traits.name: Damage Resistance
traits.description: You have resistance to lightning damage.

name: Copper Dragonborn
description: Copper dragonborn inherit their ancestors' wit and love of jokes. They tend to be good-humored pranksters who value cleverness and enjoy a good riddle.

traits.name: Breath Weapon
traits.description: You can use your action to exhale a 5 by 30 ft. line of acid. Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC = 8 + Constitution modifier + proficiency bonus). A creature takes 2d6 acid damage on a failed save, and half as much on a successful one. The damage increases to 3d6 at 6th level, 4d6 at 11th level, and 5d6 at 16th level. After using your breath weapon, you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

traits.name: Damage Resistance
traits.description: You have resistance to acid damage.

name: Gold Dragonborn
description: Gold dragonborn are descended from the most powerful and majestic of metallic dragons. They tend toward leadership roles and hold themselves to high standards of conduct.

traits.name: Breath Weapon
traits.description: You can use your action to exhale a 15 ft. cone of fire. Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC = 8 + Constitution modifier + proficiency bonus). A creature takes 2d6 fire damage on a failed save, and half as much on a successful one. The damage increases to 3d6 at 6th level, 4d6 at 11th level, and 5d6 at 16th level. After using your breath weapon, you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

traits.name: Damage Resistance
traits.description: You have resistance to fire damage.

name: Green Dragonborn
description: Green dragonborn trace their lineage to the cunning green dragons of the forests. They tend to be manipulative and patient, preferring subtle approaches to problems.

traits.name: Breath Weapon
traits.description: You can use your action to exhale a 15 ft. cone of poison. Each creature in the area must make a Constitution saving throw (DC = 8 + Constitution modifier + proficiency bonus). A creature takes 2d6 poison damage on a failed save, and half as much on a successful one. The damage increases to 3d6 at 6th level, 4d6 at 11th level, and 5d6 at 16th level. After using your breath weapon, you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

traits.name: Damage Resistance
traits.description: You have resistance to poison damage.

name: Red Dragonborn
description: Red dragonborn descend from the fierce and greedy red dragons. They tend to be proud, ambitious, and quick to anger, with a strong drive to accumulate power and wealth.

traits.name: Breath Weapon
traits.description: You can use your action to exhale a 15 ft. cone of fire. Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC = 8 + Constitution modifier + proficiency bonus). A creature takes 2d6 fire damage on a failed save, and half as much on a successful one. The damage increases to 3d6 at 6th level, 4d6 at 11th level, and 5d6 at 16th level. After using your breath weapon, you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

traits.name: Damage Resistance
traits.description: You have resistance to fire damage.

name: Silver Dragonborn
description: Silver dragonborn inherit their ancestors' love of humanity and other humanoid races. They are typically friendly and helpful, often living among other races rather than in isolated communities.

traits.name: Breath Weapon
traits.description: You can use your action to exhale a 15 ft. cone of cold. Each creature in the area must make a Constitution saving throw (DC = 8 + Constitution modifier + proficiency bonus). A creature takes 2d6 cold damage on a failed save, and half as much on a successful one. The damage increases to 3d6 at 6th level, 4d6 at 11th level, and 5d6 at 16th level. After using your breath weapon, you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

traits.name: Damage Resistance
traits.description: You have resistance to cold damage.

name: White Dragonborn
description: White dragonborn descend from the savage white dragons of the frozen north. They tend to be more bestial than other dragonborn, with a fierce survival instinct.

traits.name: Breath Weapon
traits.description: You can use your action to exhale a 15 ft. cone of cold. Each creature in the area must make a Constitution saving throw (DC = 8 + Constitution modifier + proficiency bonus). A creature takes 2d6 cold damage on a failed save, and half as much on a successful one. The damage increases to 3d6 at 6th level, 4d6 at 11th level, and 5d6 at 16th level. After using your breath weapon, you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

traits.name: Damage Resistance
traits.description: You have resistance to cold damage.

name: Human
description: In the reckonings of most worlds, humans are the youngest of the common races, late to arrive on the world scene and short-lived in comparison to dwarves, elves, and dragons. Perhaps it is because of their shorter lives that they strive to achieve as much as they can.

traits.name: Extra Language
traits.description: You can speak, read, and write one extra language of your choice.

name: Standard Human
description: Standard humans represent the versatile nature of humanity, capable of excelling in any field they choose. Their adaptability and ambition drive them to master diverse skills.

name: Variant Human
description: Variant humans exemplify humanity's remarkable adaptability. From birth, they display specialized talents that set them apart, allowing them to excel in their chosen pursuits.

traits.name: Ability Score Increase
traits.description: Two different ability scores of your choice increase by 1.

traits.name: Skills
traits.description: You gain proficiency in one skill of your choice.

traits.name: Feat
traits.description: You gain one feat of your choice.

name: Half-Orc
description: Whether united under the leadership of a mighty warlock or having fought to a standstill after years of conflict, orc and human tribes sometimes form alliances. When these alliances are sealed by marriages, half-orcs are born.

traits.name: Menacing
traits.description: You gain proficiency in the Intimidation skill.

traits.name: Relentless Endurance
traits.description: When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 hit point instead. You can't use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

traits.name: Savage Attacks
traits.description: When you score a critical hit with a melee weapon attack, you can roll one of the weapon's damage dice one additional time and add it to the extra damage of the critical hit.

name: Gnome
description: A constant hum of busy activity pervades the warrens and neighborhoods where gnomes form their close-knit communities. Louder sounds punctuate the hum: a crunch of grinding gears here, a minor explosion there, a yelp of surprise or triumph.

traits.name: Gnome Cunning
traits.description: You have advantage on all Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws against magic.

name: Forest Gnome
description: As a forest gnome, you have a natural knack for illusion and inherent quickness and stealth. Forest gnomes are rare and secretive, gathering in hidden communities in sylvan forests.

traits.name: Natural Illusionist
traits.description: You know the Minor Illusion cantrip. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for it.

traits.name: Speak with Small Beasts
traits.description: Through sounds and gestures, you can communicate simple ideas with Small or smaller beasts.

name: Rock Gnome
description: As a rock gnome, you have a natural inventiveness and hardiness beyond that of other gnomes. Most gnomes in the worlds of D&D are rock gnomes, including the tinker gnomes of Krynn.

traits.name: Artificer's Lore
traits.description: Whenever you make an Intelligence (History) check related to magic items, alchemical objects, or technological devices, you can add twice your proficiency bonus, instead of any proficiency bonus you normally apply.

traits.name: Tinker
traits.description: You have proficiency with artisan's tools (tinker's tools). Using those tools, you can spend 1 hour and 10 gp worth of materials to construct a Tiny clockwork device (AC 5, 1 hp). The device ceases to function after 24 hours unless you spend 1 hour repairing it. You can have up to three such devices active at a time.

name: Halfling
description: The comforts of home are the goals of most halflings' lives: a place to settle in peace and quiet, far from marauding monsters and clashing armies; a blazing fire and a generous meal; fine drink and fine conversation.

traits.name: Lucky
traits.description: When you roll a 1 on the d20 for an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll.

traits.name: Brave
traits.description: You have advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

traits.name: Nimble
traits.description: You can move through the space of any creature that is of a size larger than yours.

name: Lightfoot Halfling
description: As a lightfoot halfling, you can easily hide from notice, even using other people as cover. You're inclined to be affable and get along well with others. Lightfoots are more prone to wanderlust than other halflings.

traits.name: Naturally Stealthy
traits.description: You can attempt to hide even when you are obscured only by a creature that is at least one size larger than you.

name: Stout Halfling
description: As a stout halfling, you're hardier than average and have some resistance to poison. Some say that stouts have dwarven blood, and they are sometimes called stronghearts in regions where they're common.

traits.name: Stout Resilience
traits.description: You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance against poison damage.

name: Tiefling
description: To be greeted with stares and whispers, to suffer violence and insult on the street, to see mistrust and fear in every eye: this is the lot of the tiefling. Their appearance and their nature are not their fault but the result of an ancient sin.

traits.name: Hellish Resistance
traits.description: You have resistance to fire damage.

name: Asmodeus Tiefling
description: The tieflings connected to Nessus command the power of fire and darkness, guided by a keener than normal intellect, as befits those linked to Asmodeus himself. Such tieflings bear the standard tiefling appearance.

traits.name: Infernal Legacy
traits.description: You know the thaumaturgy cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the hellish rebuke spell as a 2nd-level spell once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. When you reach 5th level, you can cast the darkness spell once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.
